Flexing one's muscles: The new way of doing politics
subhead: Some politicians now openly display their muscles, both to win over voters and to establish a physical contrast with their rivals. This breaks with the French democratic tradition, which has long favored minds over bodies.

title: Trump and Sisi to host Gaza peace summit on Monday
subhead: US President Donald Trump and Egypt's Abdel Fattah al-Sisi will chair a Gaza peace summit Monday in Sharm el-Sheikh in a bid to end the war and pave the way for a new era of regional stability.

title: Côte d'Ivoire's opposition is repressed as the presidential election campaign begins
subhead: While President Alassane Ouattara, who is running for a fourth term in office, held a major rally in the center of the country, the two main opposition parties were unable to stage their own events.

title: The two-year ordeal of Gaza's Nasser Hospital
subhead: The Israeli army's relentless targeting of Nasser Hospital has shed light on the true nature of the war it has waged against the Palestinian enclave since October 2023, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Cameroon's Paul Biya runs for an eighth presidential term, yet hope for change emerges
subhead: While Cameroon's president, Paul Biya, seeks an eighth term in office at the age of 92, Issa Tchiroma Bakary, a former minister turned opposition leader, has benefited from a sudden surge in popularity.

title: 'One Battle After Another' stirs political passion in the US
subhead: Lauded as a 'rallying cry' by some and denounced as 'glorifying terrorism' by others, the film has been dissected in starkly opposing terms, writes Le Monde's Thomas Sotinel in his column.

title: In Israeli prisons, hunger and torture are ever-present
subhead: Le Monde has collected the accounts of three civilians from the West Bank who were detained for months without trial or judgment and subjected to food deprivation and regular beatings. Two years after the beginning of the war against Gaza, more than 11,000 Palestinians remain incarcerated in Israel.
